definition: to throw/to fling/to swing/to leave behind/to throw off/to dump (sb)
radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 13), occurring in 用, 同, 网 etc/see also 同字框[tong2 zi4 kuang4]
two/2/(Beijing dialect) stupid
component in Chinese characters/archaic variant of 毫[hao2]/archaic variant of 乙[yi3]
to throw off/to abandon/to cast off/to get rid of/to dump
to mark down (the price of goods)/to sell off cheap
to swing one's arms/to wash one's hands of sth
to throw off inhibitions/to go all out
to uncouple (wagons or trucks from a train)
to swing one's sleeve (in anger)
clearance sale/fire sale
to fling vigorously/fig. to reduce drastically
to throw off/to fling sth up (in anger)/refers to dramatic sale prices
to shake/to fling one's arm/to lash/to swing
lit. to fling off a bundle/fig. to abandon one's responsibility for sth/to wash one's hands of the matter
drifting (motorsport)
lit. arm-flinging shopkeeper/fig. sb who asks others to work but does nothing himself
to fling one's arms and stamp one's feet (in anger or despair)
to grimace with displeasure/to pull a long face

sentences.english: After a hot argument， she wrote off her boyfriend.
sentences.chinese: 她和男朋友大吵了一架之後，就把他甩了。

sentences.english: The Japanese government worries their country is lagging behind in terms of FTAs.
sentences.chinese: 日本政府擔心日本會在自由貿易協議方面被甩在後面。

sentences.english: He grabbed the pack with the FENRIS warheads, and swung it over his shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 他抓起裝着芬里斯核彈頭的揹包，甩上了他的肩膀。

sentences.english: Don Fernando gave me a look that seemed to bore a hole in me.
sentences.chinese: 費南多先生甩了我一眼，眼神犀利好像要刺穿我身體。

sentences.english: I plopped a $20 bill on the counter.
sentences.chinese: 我把一張20美元的鈔票甩在櫃檯上。

sentences.english: He was thrown from a taxi.
sentences.chinese: 他從一輛出租車上被甩了出去。

sentences.english: QUARITCH catches him with the other arm, hurling him away.
sentences.chinese: 誇裏奇用另一隻手抓住傑克，把他甩了出去。

sentences.english: And he shook off the beast into the fire, and felt no harm.
sentences.chinese: 保羅竟把那蛇，甩在火裏，並沒有受傷。

sentences.english: She has of course left me far behind.
sentences.chinese: 她當然把我遠遠地甩在後面了。

sentences.english: And the lion in the water shook his mane and showed his teeth.
sentences.chinese: 同樣，水中的獅子也甩了甩頭上的鬃毛露出了牙齒。

sentences.english: She dumped the dream XiaoWei a slap, warned her from seith.
sentences.chinese: 她甩了夢曉薇一耳光，告誡她遠離呂磊。

sentences.english: I can't understand why he dumped his girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 我真搞不明白爲什麼他甩了他女朋友。

sentences.english: After Megan dumped Chuck, Chuck go to the bar to drhave his sorrows over a beer.
sentences.chinese: 自從梅甘甩了查克後，查克就到酒吧借酒消愁。

sentences.english: I shook off the sweat and ths sun.
I shook off the sweat and ths sun.
In fact, sometimes I've been left standing as the technology bandwagon pulls away.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，有的時候我曾經被流行技術甩在身後。

to fling back one's head
